turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Their loads are poly-drug.  "E" from Holland, methamphetamine precursors from Jordan, Afghan "H." Mid-ocean transshipments.  His real business is:  he's a network.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: And we can illuminate part of it from the inside out.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: So we want to change-up the mission statement.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Hey, fuck him.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Chill out Sonny.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: We're the ones doing the death- defying shit? And he wants us to give that up? For what? A chump-change bust so he can get his picture in The Miami Herald to impress the slug farm in DC...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: What is going on...?!

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: As in...?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: There is "undercover."  And there is "Which way is up?"

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: You think I am in so deep I forgot?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: I am asking.  You to me.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Do you <u>believe</u>...I have forgotten I am a cop?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: I would never doubt you.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: If you see a few new faces, don't get jumpy...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: And José, my ace, lots of transshipment.  Lots of action. Skies are crowded.  And the JIT has assets on land, air, and sea.  So any intel you got that can come our way and contribute to the good and welfare...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: What's your take?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: What's the point?  It's going down.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Call the US Coast Guard:  "Come and arrest our ass."  And Switek resumes romancing Miss Ukraine...

turns.speaker: TRUDY
turns.text: Eleven to seven he blows it.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Twenty on my man...

turns.speaker: TRUDY
turns.text: You're giving away your money, fool...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: TRUDY
turns.text: Too fast.  Too many moving parts.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Switek?

turns.speaker: TRUDY
turns.text: If we were for real, and knew our shit, we'd fade this one...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Then you should.

turns.speaker: TRUDY
turns.text: If you're down, we're down for the play.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: This is Agent James Fujima.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Detective Crockett.

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: What's your Miami PD badge number?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Okay.  What's up?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: A C.I. we cut loose to your Joint Interagency Task Force.  Name of Alonzo Stevens.  Now, he's YOUR informant.  Stevens, called us.  I haven't spoken to him for six months. I do not know what case you have him on.  I do not know what he is talking about.  But whatever he is doing for you, it sounds like it is going bad.  Right now...

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: How do I discuss operations over an open line?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: How do I know?  I got the call from Alonzo on an open line.  That is the hand we have been dealt at this moment, at eleven-forty-seven o'clock Friday night.  Okay?  I am trying to alert you, here.  <u>You</u> know whether or not...you have a thing goin' down.  I do not.  But we know this guy.  I think you know this guy.  Normally, he is cool.  Tonight he is distraught. That is atypical.  That engenders foreboding.  Do you understand the meaning of the word "foreboding"? As in badness is happening to <u>your</u> deal right fucking now?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Guy's involved in a "meet"...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: "Buy and walk"?  "Buy and bust"? "Reverse undercover"?  What?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Meet and greet.  "I flash you some of mine, you flash me some of yours?"

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: And the deal goes down at another place at another time.

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: ...so there's <u>no</u> industrial- strength HRT weapons team out there tonight?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: OMGs, Mongols, Nazi Low-Riders, prison gangs?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: NLR, we think.  I wanna know...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: How?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: We don't know.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: So what do you want?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: To recruit you.

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Get into business with this crew, identify them.  Illuminate their network.  If you're lucky, discover their source, how they penetrated us.  We'll indict and take it from there...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: How do we do that?  Make a buy?  That went well...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: From whom...?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: A Colombian producer.  Named Archangel de Jesus Montoya-Londono.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Never heard of him.

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: From the North Valle area.  New. Low-level, we think.

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Who said, "go exploring"?  We want this staying on track.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Who's the "we"?  There's you and there's us.  And all we got from you was bad intel.  "Low-level producer."  Yeah, right...

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Montoya.  We went to meet the village priest.  It turns into Alice in the fucking Vatican and here's the Pope...of the North Valle Colombia dope trade.

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Out of...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Haiti and Puerto Rico.  Money through Dubai and Geneva maybe.

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Control your men.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: I'm my <u>own</u> man.  And anytime you want to see how much man I am?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: This I gotta see...  ...the "make up an excuse and stop" part.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Have faith.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: I have faith.  In horoscopes and fortune cookies...

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: "Hi, Gina.  Hi, Sonny."

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Hi, Gina.  This is from Frick and Frack. Trudy?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: You're so <u>not</u> the PD, if you got busted on a DUI, you're in serious trouble...you're bad men back to grammar school.  San Quentin.  Pelican Bay.  Marine Corps.  Statesville. Pelican Bay, where you guys hooked up.  Now you're too smart and too fast to get jacked again...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: How will it stand up?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: If they ran the rental car or lease on this place...even if it's EPIC database in El Paso...they'd have to work through the layers of bullshit three weeks deep.  Then they'd find your deeper, hidden criminal selves...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Yeah...?

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: Sonny...?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: Where's Riccardo?

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: On the phone.

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm sorry, Sonny...

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: It's fucked up.  I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Alonzo?  What are you talking about?  Where are you...?

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: They had me from the gate.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: I don't understand...

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: I gave up nothing on you guys. Don't worry.  I kept you and Rico out of it.  Only the Feds.  They're on their own...it's all their deal, anyway, so fuck 'em.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Alonzo, what's goin' on?!

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: After I check on Francine and the boys, then I'm gone.  Sonny, tell Rico I'm so sorry.  I wanted you to know...

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: ...look after her.  Ask Rico to. Okay?  Do that for me.  I had to do it.  They had me from the gate. Do that.  Whatever you can do for them.  Okay?  Look what I did to them, Sonny...!

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: Alonzo...!

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: CROCKETT
turns.text: How'd they get onto you?

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: How do I know?  But it was from the get-go.  Knew the FBI had run me into them.  Sonny, I gotta go...!

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Correct.  Flash samples.  Flash cash.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Haitian, Dominican, Russian, Israeli?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: White supremacist types.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Oh, good...

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: ...what else, what else did he indicate to you?  I need to know everything he said.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: C'mon, man!

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: We think NLR.  We don't know! Alonzo only fronted as a broker for our guys to make the meet.  He wasn't deep into the crew.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Break your encryption?  Hack your e- mail?  Employee databases? Somebody on the inside?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: We don't know.  And that's the point.  Maybe there's a mole. Whatever, it's a disaster.  And it's a Joint Interagency Task Force.  I have DEA, ATF, U.S. Customs components in on it.  So the penetration could be from any one agency.  What we do know is I have to suspend operations right now from undercover work through interdictions 'cause I have to assume our Operational Security is blown.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: As in, your ass is dead in the water.

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: But Miami PD wasn't part of the J.I.T.  And from what Alonzo said, he didn't give you up.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Reverse undercover?  WE supply to them?

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: They got a steady stream of supply. So, no...

turns.speaker: FUJIMA
turns.text: Who are you talking to?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: He's talking to you, bro.  What he means to say is he is reluctant to abandon the penetration of a major narcotrafficking organization...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Switek pulling this off...?  That's not faith; that's delusional...

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Only African he ever "relocated" was a $2,000-an-hour Nigerian model for Gucci, and he got wounded when she took an NBA draft choice to the Super Bowl instead of him...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: He did volunteer one time...

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: What am I supposed to do after I get my nails and hair done...?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Reality TV and stay by the phone. That's what all wives-in-crime do...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Yes.  What's up?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Nothing.  Calling to say hi... What's up with you?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Bored.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Okay...see you soon.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: ...and thanks for the flowers.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: What flowers?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: The bouquet, here.  Five-hundred dollars worth of roses...yellow.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: You mean with the flowers...?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: What's it say?

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: "Salutations from the south..."

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Good idea.  We'll grab a bite.

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: ...the lease, the phones, the cars...layers of false ident. Would take the FBI weeks.  How long did it take them?  Three hours? Four?  This means, "We can reach out and touch somebody."  Like Bad Teleflora.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: ...even if they could run the identities you built to EPIC, all they'll find is more cover... Trust what you built.  It's quality, girl.  We're cool...

turns.speaker: GINA
turns.text: ...you are trying to reassure me because you know when people get anxious, they make mistakes. You're worried about me.  Do not be.  I am careful.  I am cool.  I got Trudy, backup, whatever.  You worry about you.  Because you are the ones who are in denied territory, not me.  If your focus is on me, you'll miss something coming at you.  That's how people slip up. Get hurt.  And I'd die if anything happened.  You worry about <u>you</u>. You and Sonny...are in the dangerous place.  I'm fine...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: ...and we're looking at Nigerian crude...

turns.speaker: MONTOYA
turns.text: Precursor shipments from Ras Tanura and Ju'aymah?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Transshipped to a Malaysian container ship.

turns.speaker: MONTOYA
turns.text: Not French registry?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: They've been targeted.  And Pakistani registry is too vulnerable to search and seizure right now.

turns.speaker: MONTOYA
turns.text: José doesn't like the deal in South Florida...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Burnett?  They want 22% of the value on loads they run into South Florida.  It's the Juarez cartel model. They guarantee the loads.  The upside is our risk goes to zero. That frees-up capital.

turns.speaker: MONTOYA
turns.text: But what does your intuition tell you...?

turns.speaker: MONTOYA
turns.text: And...?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: They're serious.  They're cautious. They'll forgo a deal over a technicality of how a delivery's handled...they'd walk away, rather than compromise operational security...that's good.

turns.speaker: MONTOYA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: A good deal, like this with us, for Burnett will be good only temporarily.  He'll get restless because he believes nothing is forever.  Life is dust, make it while you can.  He's ambitious.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I think José suspects anybody he doesn't intimidate.  And people, who are good at what they do?  They have egos, too...

turns.speaker: MONTOYA
turns.text: What would you do...?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I like the diminished risk.  It frees up capital reserves.  I like working with self-interested businessmen who are competent.  You can predict their behavior....

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I run down the numbers.  Nothing is very negotiable.  Small loads?  We pay three thousand a ki. We pay your fuel costs up front plus ten percent.  The next ten percent on U.S. landfall.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Define small.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Two, three thousand a ki. Two thousand ki's, your end is $6,000,000.  Complex transshipments or dealing with containers, these have front- loaded costs we pickup.  For this kind of weight, the balance of 80% is when our buyer picks up the load.  Transactions are offshore.  Dollars or euros.  Secure internet transfers.  We have lists of Cayman and Isle of Man banks infiltrated by IRS, to be avoided...  No transactions of cash or other banking instruments take place on U.S. soil...  That's the deal.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: And as an investment in the future...

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: "Future" of...?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Conveyance?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Maritime.  Jose will fill you in.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: That sonofabitch!

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: You set this up!

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Of course!  That is why I placed myself here, with you, knowing Yero would pull this crap.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: It's all bullshit.  Jesus is out of communication in Fals de Iguazu. José knows that...  Whatever he's going to do, he has to do it fast because he's acting on his own. And he will need a story.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Meaning...?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: They will kill you.  And then they will kill your wife, too.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: So lay it out, my brother...

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Nicholas said you okay.  That's nice.  But how I know if you any good?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Equipment?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Slow and low, Adam A-500s...  ...carbon composite, stealthy, 1400 nautical-mile range, thousand ki payload...all the way to Caravels and 727's from a source country to a transshipment point.  Small freighters.  We've done containers...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: And violence is extra.  And expensive.  So how much weight you looking to move?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Nothing.  'Cause how you do delivery on the beach, I don't like.  Maybe this does not work.

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: What do you care?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Do we need this...?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Then what were we talking to you for?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: I had to lay eyes on you.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: What do I care what you think about how he looks?  You wanna fuck my partner or do business?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Wait by the phone.  You get a call.  Or maybe you don't.  Until then, piss off back to where you come from...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: This the load you lost a while back?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: It is.  He try to take tonight's load?

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: I walk into Neptune's house...very nice.  But I also see you... and our drugs that got ripped from Maguda.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: You don't like us finding your load?  We can go and lose it all over again...

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: Transshipment point is here at 17:00 hours on the 23rd.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Uh-uh.  No predetermined places and times to meet.  Give me their heading and radio codes and I will talk to them directly with the longs and lats and time which will be a last minute deal...

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: <u>You</u> give <u>yours</u> to me.  <u>We</u> position all the assets hauling our loads...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Importation value?  At twenty-two thousand a ki...

turns.speaker: JOSÉ YERO
turns.text: You work that out with La Senora.  You will get sixteen fuel bladders of crystal meth precursors from the Malaysian ship.  For collection in North Miami.  You warehouse it. Release it when we say.  I'm sure you have friends with fast boats...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: What the hell did you do?

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: The Feeb gig was I front a coupla undercover, Russian-speakers to them.  One's ATF.  And broker the deal.  Set up the meet with the NLR types...

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: I gotta, I gotta go...!

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Alonzo...

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: What...?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Alonzo, you don't need to go home.

turns.speaker: STEVENS
turns.text: They said they wouldn't hurt them, wouldn't hurt them if...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: They lied.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Beg pardon, ma'am. I'm brand spanking new to this town, come from Houston, Texas, and hoping to get a look at the Statue of Liberty...

turns.speaker: CASS
turns.text: You're hoping to get a look at what?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: The Statue of Liberty.

turns.speaker: CASS
turns.text: It's up in Central Park, taking a leak. If you hurry, you'll make the supper show. Now get lost.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Don't know what line Morey's in, but myself now, fact is -- I'm a hustler.

turns.speaker: CASS
turns.text: Hers'n zodda meg a livig.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Beg pardon, ma'am?

turns.speaker: CASS
turns.text: Said, a person's gotta make a living.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You sure you heard what I said?

turns.speaker: CASS
turns.text: Scuse me, hon, fraid I'm only half here. Maybe you oughta run on along. But why don't you take this phone number?

turns.speaker: CASS
turns.text: You're such a doll. I hate money, don't you? God, it's been fun.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Funny thing, you mentioning money. I was just about to ask your for some...

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: You ain't coming to work?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Don't guess. Just come for my day's pay owing and to tell you I'm heading East.

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: What you gonna do back there, East?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Lotta rich women back there...

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Men, they mostly faggots.

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: Must be some mess back there.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, ain't no use hanging around here.

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: Ain't gonna collect your pay?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I got me two hundred twenty-four bucks of flat folding money...  He know what he can do with that chicken-shit day's pay. And if he ain't man enough to do it for himself, I be happy to oblige!

turns.speaker: RICH LADY
turns.text: Were you looking? About the Statue of Liberty?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Joking? No, ma'am. Oh no! I mean business!

turns.speaker: RICH LADY
turns.text: I'm sorry. I thought you were -- never mind -- I've never actually been there, but let me see, you take the Seventh Avenue subway, I think, to the end of the line...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You sure are a pretty lady.

turns.speaker: RICH LADY
turns.text: You're not looking for the Statue of Liberty at all.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No, ma'am, I'm not.

turns.speaker: RICH LADY
turns.text: Why, that's perfectly dreadful. Aren't you ashamed of yourself?

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I can tell, can't you?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yeah, oh yeah.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: What'll we do? Leave now or what? Your place or mine? Oh God, the second I looked at you I knew. Did you?

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: He's got taxi fare.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Sure you're all right?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, that's something never happened to me before, you can bet your bottom dollar. Uh, where's the matches, ma'am?

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Top drawer. Maybe if you didn't call me ma'am, things would work out better.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You think I'm lying!

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: No. Of course not. Just something struck me funny...

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Maybe we should take a little nap, see what happens?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I ain't sleepy.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: I know. Scribbage!

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: That's pretty Freudian, Joe.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What? It's a perfectly good word, ain't it. How much time I got?  Goddam sand thing drive you crazy. Kee-rist. Spelling never was a very strong point with me. Even in school.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: If you didn't talk so much, maybe you could think more.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Talking helps. Don't talk, you get muddled in your head. Hey! Now you just look at this here!

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: There's an E in MONEY. If that's your word.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: M-O-N-Y -- I'm right! That's just exactly how they spell it up there on that big building, bet you could see it from here. M-O-N-Y.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Okay. Never argue with a man.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Y -- what in hell starts with Y?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Cut it out. That's cheating, teasing me so I can't think. Just one bitsy Y word and I gonna beat you!

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: You gonna beat me, Joe?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Beat your butt, you don't lemme think!

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Gay ends in Y. Fey. You like that -- gay fey -- is that your problem?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I show you what problem --

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: That is one hell of a shirt. I bet you paid a pretty price for it, am I right?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Oh, it ain't cheap. I mean, yeah, I'd say this was an all right shirt. Don't like to, uh, you know, have a lot of cheap stuff on my back.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Shee-it...  Kee-rist, you really know the ropes. Wish to hell I bumped into you before. I'm Joe Buck from Texas and I'm gonna buy you a drink, what do you say to that?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Enrico Rizzo from the Bronx. Don't mind if I do.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Same all around! For my friend, too!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: ... you see what I'm getting at here? She got a penthouse up there with color TV and more goddam diamonds than an archbishop and she busts out bawling when I ask for money!

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: For money.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: For money for what?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm a hustler, hell, didn't you know that?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: How would I know? You gotta tell a person these things  A hustler? Picking up trade on the street like that -- baby, believe me -- you need management.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I think you just put your finger on it, I do.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: My friend O'Daniel. That's who you need. Operates the biggest stable in town. In the whole goddam metropolitan area. A stud like you - paying! -- not that I blame you -- a dame starts crying, I cut my heart for her...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hey, listen, how about you take me to mee this Mister O'Diddle bird right now?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Well, Joe, you're a nice guy, and I'd be doing you both a favor, but why? What'm I dragging my bum leg all over town for? It's no picnic and what for, for me myself, what?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Tomorrow when some piece like that's scratching your back in a Fifth Avenue townhouse, where'll your pal Rizzo be? Nedicks.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hold it, just hold it. You think I'm that kinda sombitch? Just name your cut, whatever you want, you got it right now. Five? Ten, how's that?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Let's see how you look. Fine. You look fine. Now I'm gonna have to have that other ten...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Ten, ten -- I got a twenty -- take that...

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Oh hell, forget it.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Now take it. Go on.  Listen, where can I reach you? Cause I'm gonna make this right with you soon's I get me set up...

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I mean, dammit, where you live?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What's in your socks?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Not a cent, I swear to God, I swear on my mother's eyes.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: You keep the sixty-four cents. I want you to have it.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: It's sticky. What you do, slobber on 'em? I wouldn't touch 'em.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You want some free medical advice, shut your goddam mouth about that night.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Okay, right, right, okay. Another subject. Where you living? Still at the hotel?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Listen, keep away from me, hear? You come near me again, I snatch you bald-headed!

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I'm inviting you. I mean if you're not located, I got a place. I'm inviting you, goddamit.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You inviting shee-it.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Smart thing for me to do is haul ass outta here.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Whatsa matter now?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You don't seem like no fag...

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: So you could sleep! I mean Christ!

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I drug in a cot, if you want to stay.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well now, Ratso, I'm gonna tell you something for your own good, only first gimme a cigarette.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You want me to stay here tonight, is that the idea?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I ain't forcing you, like, I mean, who's forcing you?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Oh. Guess I got the wrong impression.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I want you to stay, okay? I goddam invited you, didn't I?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, I hope you know what you're in for. I'm a very dangerous person. Someone does me bad like you. If I caught up with you that night, there'd be one dead Ratso long about now. Hear?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I'm impressed. You're a killer.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: So if you want me to hang around for a few days, I thought you should know.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Joe -- do me one favor -- this is my place, am I wrong? You know, in my own place my name ain't Ratso. I mean it so happens my name is Enrico Salvatore Rizzo.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Shee-it, man, I can't say all that.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Rico then, at least call me Rico in my own goddam place.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Rico! Rico! Rico! Is that enough?  And keep your meat hooks off my radio.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: The two basic items necessary to sustain life are sunshine and coconut milk. That's a known fact. If I can find the goddam hole the milk squirts out.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: This is an okay setup you got here, but I'd say you ain't just exactly, uh, flush, is that right or not?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I been sick. Hold this, will ya?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: In Florida, they come smooth, ready to eat. Down there, your only problem is, diet-wise, you gotta lift an arm to wipe warm milk off your chin. Tough, hey?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I think finding you's the smartest thing I ever did, for both of us. You just the crooked kinda sneaky little sidewinder I need to get me hustling in this town. Hey!

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Miami Beach is the only place for a real hustler. Florida has more rich chicks per square yard than any resort spot in the world. They lie out in their pagodas and pergolas waiting to grab the first jockstrap that passes.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What's all this sweet talk about Florida? Your friend O'Daniel got a stable down there now?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Look at yourself, Joe, no offense, but frankly, you're beginning to smell. For a stud in this town that's a handicap.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You talk like a man with a tin twat.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: You ain't got a chance in hell. You need threads and glitter, baby. A front, hey?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, uh, my manager's gonna manage all that crap, or else he gonna get a coconut up his flue.
